intro: Githago thessala, commonly known as the Greek violet, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Githago thessala is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
